channel.title: Usagi Electric
channel.description:
Welcome to Usagi Electric!
On this channel, we dive into old school technology, focusing heavily on vacuum tubes. My primary goal is to build computing circuits based off the legendary machines of yesteryear, only with a slight modern twist. All the tubes will be operating with very low voltages on the plate, making the projects safe and easy to follow along with. So, lets grab our multimeters, some random tubes and a low voltage power supply and have fun!
Usagi Electric covers one of my main passions, while my other main passion can be found over on Usagi Motors.

channel.itunes:subtitle: Usagi Electric

On this channel, we dive into old school technology, focusing heavily on vacuum tubes. item.title: Rescuing a Rare version of BASIC with the Data General Nova!
item.description:
It’s time to get the TechTran 8410 tape drive fully up and working, so we can plug it into the Data General Nova 1210 and rescue some ultra rare software, notably BURP, which stands for BASIC language User Responsive Program. A top-tier backronym if I’ve ever seen one!
Come join us at VCF SoCal, East and SouthWest: https://www.vcfsw.org/
If you want to support the channel please hop over to Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/usagielectric
Also, we now have some epic shirts for sale! https://my-store-11554688.creator-spring.com
Come join us on Discord: Discord: https://discord.gg/p7UsfHD
Intro Music adapted from: Artist: The Runaway Five Title: The Shinra Shuffle https://ocremix.org/remix/OCR01847
Thanks for watching!
Chapters 0:00 One of the rarest flavors of BASIC out there 1:16 A real deal, proper 2-track mag tape drive on the bench! 4:38 Let the troubleshooting begin 8:07 It’s cabling, it’s always cabling… 11:00 Rescue mode initiated! 12:47 Job done! It wasn’t easy though… (CM) 15:43 Baud rate issues 17:07 Running BURP! 22:47 Come use BURP in person at VCFSW! 24:36 Rawr! I’m a vicious predator!
